q1.question: How can this be completely free?
q1.answer: LocalPDF runs entirely on your device, so we have zero cloud infrastructure costs. No servers to maintain, no bandwidth to pay for. We believe AI should be accessible to everyone. Our code is open source under MIT license - audit it yourself.

q2.question: How accurate is the AI analysis?
q2.answer: LocalPDF uses state-of-the-art open source AI models optimized for document understanding. While cloud services may use larger models, our local models provide excellent accuracy for summarization, Q&A, and data extraction - with the critical advantage that your documents never leave your device.

q3.question: Will this work without an internet connection?
q3.answer: Absolutely! After the initial model download (one-time, happens on first run), LocalPDF works 100% offline. Analyze documents on airplanes, in remote locations, or in air-gapped environments.

q4.question: Can I use this for commercial work?
q4.answer: Yes! LocalPDF is MIT licensed. Use it for personal projects, client work, or commercial products. No attribution required (though always appreciated).

q5.question: What PDF formats and sizes are supported?
q5.answer: LocalPDF handles standard PDF files of any size - no page or file size limits. It works with text-based PDFs, scanned documents (with OCR), and mixed-content PDFs containing images and tables.

q6.question: What are the system requirements?
q6.answer:
Minimum: 8GB RAM, 10GB free storage, macOS 12+ or Windows 10+
Recommended: 16GB RAM, Apple Silicon or NVIDIA GPU for faster processing
